alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN... EAST CENTRAL CAROLINE...NORTHWESTERN KING WILLIAM AND WEST CENTRAL ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Aylett, or near Saint Stephens Church, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Beulahville around 720 PM EDT. Newtown around 735 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Beazley, Enfield, Central Garage, Owenton, Hustle, Elevon, Upshaw, Central Point, Etna Mills, and Rexburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
